title: Topological inverse Anderson insulator
authors: Zheng-Wei Zuo and Jing-Run Lin and Dawei Kang
abstract:
A different type of topological phase dubbed topological inverse Anderson
insulators is proposed, which is characterized by the disorder-induced extended
bulk states from the flat-band localization and topological edge states. Based
on the topological invariant, the behaviors of the localization length of the
zero-energy modes, and quantum transport, we identify its existence in several
all-band-flat models with the disordered potentials or hopping including the
$\pi$-flux Creutz ladder, the fully dimerized Su-Schrieffer-Heeger chain, and
$\pi$-flux diamond chain. Unlike the topological Anderson insulator, where
disorder induces localization and exponential suppression of transport, the
disorder-assisted quantum ballistic coherent transport can appear in the
topological inverse Anderson insulator. In addition, our proposal and results
could be realized by the current experimental techniques.
subjects: Condensed Matter/Disordered Systems and Neural Networks
